meanings.definition: To attract and hold the interest and attention of someone.
meanings.sent1: The magician's tricks fascinate the children at the birthday party.
meanings.sent2: The movie's plot fascinates viewers with its unexpected twists.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's playful antics fascinate everyone in the park.
meanings.sent4: The intricate details of the painting fascinate art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent5: The scientist's discoveries never fail to fascinate the curious minds.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to be extremely interested in something.
meanings.sent1: The new video game fascinates players with its realistic graphics.
meanings.sent2: Her storytelling always fascinates her audience, leaving them wanting more.
meanings.sent3: The mystery novel fascinates readers, keeping them up all night.
meanings.sent4: The history documentary fascinates viewers by bringing the past to life.
meanings.sent5: The rare gemstone fascinates collectors due to its unique color and clarity.
